newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada's top general steps down.
newsitem.headline: Canada's top general steps down.

text.p: Canada's chief of defence staff, Gen. Jean Boyle, has resigned, Prime Minister Jean Chretien's office said on Tuesday.
Chretien said in a statement that he had "accepted Gen. Boyle's request to relieve him of his duties." Boyle's resignation followed the resignation of Defence Minister David Collenette last Friday.

Boyle and Collenette were engulfed in a scandal over an alleged cover-up of an incident involving Canadian peacekeepers in Somalia in 1992 and 1993 in which Canadian soldiers tortured and killed several Somalis.
Collenette had strongly backed Boyle even after the general admitted breaching the spirit of Canada's access-to-information laws over the incident.

Boyle was not chief of defence staff during the Somali incident but had been accused of involvement in the alleged cover-up. The Somali incident led to the disbanding of the elite Canadian Airborne Regiment.
A government-appointed inquiry is continuing into what has become known in Canada as the "Somalia affair."
